Comments_List: Various technical lab skills and knowledge in signaling, immunology, etc.

I studied CD8 T cell antigen specificity in Kevan Herold's lab in my first lab rotation.
The major experiments I do involves T cell culture, ELISA and flow cytometry. I also learned how to interpret the data of T cell libraries. This project provided preliminary data for future extensions. Prof. Herold and I have discussed many possible project direction in the future. This is recorded in a report I wrote to my lab.
Many new techniques including CRISPR, cell culturing, and molecular cloning
It could be slightly more structured in terms of stating what is expected of us during the rotation.
I liked how independent it was but that each technique was taught initially before allowing me to try the skills on my own
Yes, my rotation with David Schatz was great
